titleStmt.title: Here begynneth a ryght frutefull treatyse, intituled the myrrour of good maners co[n]teynyng the .iiii. vertues, called cardynall, compyled in latyn by Domynike Mancyn: and translate into englysshe: at the desyre of syr Gyles Alyngton knyght: by Alexander Bercley prest and monke of Ely.
De quatuor virtutibus. English
titleStmt.author: Mancinus, Dominicus, fl. 1478-1491.
Barclay, Alexander, 1475?-1552.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprynted by Rychard Pynson, prynter vnto the kynges noble grace: with his gracyous pryuylege, the whiche boke I haue prynted, at the instance of Rychard yerle of Kent,

notesStmt.note: Printer's and publisher's names from colophon; publication date from STC.
Text in Latin and English on facing pages.
A translation of: Mancinus, Dominicus. "Mancinus de quatuor virtutibus", first published in 1584 (STC 17239.3).
Some print show-through, some leaves stained and cropped at head.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the kynges noble grace: with his gracyous pryuylege, the whiche boke I haue prynted, at the instance of Rychard yerle of Kent
